screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .vid file in VideoLAN VLC media player
screenshot.caption: VID file open in VideoLAN VLC media player

description: Because VID files are now used infrequently, some programs that previously supported opening and playing VID files no longer do so. For example, you can no longer open and play VID files using Apple QuickTime Player, and Microsoft Windows Media Player does not recognize the .vid extension by default.

images.caption: VID file open in VideoLAN VLC media player
